resolution.name: Fixed

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #5065: ARROW-6210: [Java] remove equals API from ValueVector
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5065
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-6210](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6210).
   This is a follow-up from https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4933
   The callers should be fixed to use the RangeEquals API instead.

BryanCutler commented on pull request #5065: ARROW-6210: [Java] remove equals API from ValueVector
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5065#discussion_r313080729
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/compare/RangeEqualsVisitor.java
 ##########
 @@ -49,38 +56,66 @@ public RangeEqualsVisitor(ValueVector right, int leftStart, int rightStart, int
     this.rightStart = rightStart;
     this.right = right;
     this.length = length;
+    Preconditions.checkArgument(length >= 0, "length must be non negative");
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Reset start indices and length for reuse purpose.
+   */
+  public void reset(int leftStart, int rightStart, int length) {
 
 Review comment:
   I think it's better to just create a new `RangeEqualsVisitor` than add a `reset` method

tianchen92 commented on issue #5065: ARROW-6210: [Java] remove equals API from ValueVector
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5065#issuecomment-520660387
 
 
   > Should the same be done for hash?
   
   Do you mean also apply visitor mode for hash so that could apply different hash algorithm（like accept(HashVisitor visitor)? otherwise now hashCode is used for encoding and not a proper time to remove it I think.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5065#issuecomment-520672741
 
 
   > Do you mean also apply visitor mode for hash so that could apply different hash algorithm（like accept(HashVisitor visitor)? otherwise now hashCode is used for encoding and not a proper time to remove it I think.
   
   Weren't the equal methods also used for encoding?

tianchen92 commented on issue #5065: ARROW-6210: [Java] remove equals API from ValueVector
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5065#issuecomment-520674096
 
 
   > > Do you mean also apply visitor mode for hash so that could apply different hash algorithm（like accept(HashVisitor visitor)? otherwise now hashCode is used for encoding and not a proper time to remove it I think.
   > 
   > Weren't the equal methods also used for encoding?
   
   Yes, they are also used. Since https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4933 (visitor to compare two vectors) already merged. Pravindra and Bryan suggested to remove equals(int, ValueVector, int) and replace this logic in encoding hash table with RangeEqualsVisitor(with length=1) to reduce duplicated logic. And hashCode could not be replaced at the moment.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
This is a follow-up from [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4933]

The callers should be fixed to use the RangeEquals API instead.

comments.body: Thanks for opening this, I'll take it.
